meanings.definition: Strongly encourage or urge (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach exhorted the team to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent2: She exhorted her friends to join her in volunteering at the shelter.
meanings.sent3: The teacher exhorted the students to finish their homework with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The captain exhorted his crew to navigate through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The parent exhorted the child to always speak the truth.

meanings.definition: Make a strong appeal or request.
meanings.sent1: The speaker exhorted the audience to support the charity event.
meanings.sent2: He exhorted the council to consider the needs of the community.
meanings.sent3: The child exhorted his parents to buy him a new toy with puppy eyes.
meanings.sent4: The activist exhorted the government to take action against climate change.
meanings.sent5: The singer exhorted the crowd to sing along with her at the concert.
